content.description: Start sitting on a jug down low, use non existent feet to slap up to the "Dish" make moves to match the dish and move up to an undercling, small crimp out right. Use anything you can get, finish straight above the start on the huge lip.
content.protection: A couple pads makes this really safe
content.location: You can hope to another boulder or down climb the V0

content.description:
Over the overhang and up the flaky wall.

Descent down fallen tree on the south of the boulder.
content.location: The knobby face just left of the right arete on B1 Traverse Boulder.

content.description: Hands on a descent hold, toss for good holds above.
content.location: In the gully to the left of Thin Face. Climb up where the jump descent is on t-boulder.

content.description: Thin crimpy holds up a 12 foot face immediately to the right of 'Untitled.'
content.protection: Crashpad, don't swing to the right.
content.location: The thin, crimpy face immediately to the right of 'Untitled.'

content.description: Start on good holds just right of thin face. Landing is over a rock.
content.location: Start above the rock just right of Thin Face.

content.description: Start sitting low in the cave with a left hand on the obvious gaston crimp and right a tad lower, make a couple hard moves to gain the starting jug flake of the stand.
content.location: Just below thin face, back corridor of the boulder.

content.description: a series of nice crimps with the smallest one just before the top
content.location: This is on "T boulder" in the Bouldering in Souther california guide book.  It is located on the right side of the trail, about 40 feet past swiss cheese boulder.  The climb is on the backside, facing the boulder with the obvious finger crack (also a nice climb)

content.description: Start on a set of plates on the right side of the boulder, traverse along the lip to the patina plates on the left and climb along the pates to the top.
content.location:
This problem is at the trail side of what is called T-boulder in "5-Star Bouldering in So Cal". It is located approx. 40 feet past Swiss Cheese boulder.

The left 1/4 of the face has a set of patina plates
